metadata.title: CVE-2021-33829 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS for NVIDIA BlueField (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the HTML Data Processor inCKEditor 4 4.14.0 through 4.16.x before 4.16.1 allows remote attackers toinject executable JavaScript code through a crafted comment because --!> ismishandled.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-33829` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ckeditor - 4.16.0+dfsg-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ckeditor package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.16.0+dfsg-2').
